intro: Pseudanthistiria heteroclita, commonly known as the variable starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that resemble stars. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are often purple or blue in color. The species is notable for its variability in flower color and morphology, contributing to its common name.
